body:
This supports lcov `2.x` in the sense that we are no-longer hardcoding version specific options, and instead will use the `LCOV_OPTS` variable (which is the more flexible thing to do in any case). It's also quite likely that devs are already having to pass extra options to lcov `2.x`, given it's more stringent in terms of coverage generation and error checking. See this thread for an example: https://github.com/linux-test-project/lcov/issues/238.

Tested on one machine (LCOV 2.0, gcc 13.2) with:
```bash
export LCOV_OPTS="--rc branch_coverage=1 --ignore-errors mismatch"
./autogen.sh
./configure --enable-lcov CXXFLAGS="-fprofile-update=prefer-atomic"
make
make cov
<snip>
Processing file src/netaddress.cpp
  lines=521 hit=480 functions=72 hit=72 branches=675 hit=499
Overall coverage rate:
  lines......: 81.8% (79362 of 97002 lines)
  functions......: 77.8% (10356 of 13310 functions)
  branches......: 49.6% (130628 of 263196 branches)
```

and another machine (LCOV 2.0, Clang 18.1.6) with:
```bash
export LCOV_OPTS="--rc branch_coverage=1 --ignore-errors mismatch,inconsistent"
./autogen.sh
./configure --enable-lcov CC=clang CXX=clang++
make
make cov
<snip>
lcov: ERROR: "/root/ci_scratch/src/prevector.h":131: function '_ZNK9prevectorILj28EhjiE14const_iteratorltES1_ last line is 131 but is 166 in testcase 'functional_tests'
	(use "lcov --ignore-errors code_ ..." to bypass this error)
/usr/bin/genhtml -s --rc branch_coverage=1 --ignore-errors mismatch,inconsistent total_coverage.info -o total.coverage
genhtml: ERROR: cannot read file total_coverage.info!
```
The options are passed through, however (in the second example) we run into a bug fixed in lcov 2.1: https://github.com/linux-test-project/lcov/issues/259. 1.16 could be used in the mean time.

Related to #28468.
title: build: remove `--enable-lcov-branch-coverage`
